name: Theodoret of Cyrus

locations.description: Bishop of Cyrus, important figure at Council of Chalcedon

summary: Theodoret of Cyrus was a bishop, theologian, and historian who played an important role at the Council of Chalcedon (451). He was initially a supporter of Nestorius but later accepted the Chalcedonian definition. He wrote extensively on theology, biblical exegesis, and Church history. His 'Ecclesiastical History' is an important source for the period.
